para.text: There is established an Advisory Committee on Street Harassment, which shall be composed of 17 members as follows:
The Director of OHR, or the Director's designee;
The Director of the Office of Victim Services and Justice Grants, or the Director's designee;
The Director of the Mayor's Office of Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Questioning Affairs, or the Director's designee;
The Director of the District Department of Transportation, or the Director's designee;
The Chief of the Metropolitan Police Department, or the Chief's designee;
The Chairman of the Council, or the Chairman's designee;
The General Manager of the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority, or the General Manager's designee;
The Director of the Alcoholic Beverage Regulation Administration, or the Director's designee; and

Nine community representatives, appointed by the Mayor pursuant to § 1-523.01(f), who are District residents or members of organizations that engage in policy, advocacy, or direct service within the District related to:
Street harassment;
Gender-based violence;
Gender equity;
LGBTQ rights;
Racial equity;
Religious tolerance;
Poverty or homelessness; or
Immigrant rights.
The Director of OHR, or the Director's designee, shall serve as the ACSH's chairperson.
One community representative shall be selected by a majority vote of the community representatives of the ACSH to serve as vice-chairperson.
The ACSH shall meet at least on a quarterly basis, at times to be determined by the chairperson at the ACSH's first meeting.
Meetings of the ACSH shall be subject to subchapter IV of Chapter 5 of Title 2.
